Reviews.Title: “Average Stay - quality / price average +”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth B
Reviews.Content: Nice but small room & bath room, very noisy from the outside, BUT excellent staff, very kind, efficient as well at the reception desk, room cleaning & Buffet Breakfast. Excellent variety of choice of foods for breakfast. Good location (around 40mn from airport ans only 4 stations away from main turistic points: Ramblas, Sagrada familia, park Guell, Marina, casa batlo & Gotic block, etc. Didn't tried the swimming pool: beacuse of the weather. PLUS: good location, nice staff, good breakfast buffet Minus: small rooms, noisy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Canard52
Reviews.Content: Wife & I arrived here last Sunday 15th April having booked a flight/hotel package through Ebookers,however they had no apparent record of booking and, luckily they had rooms available! The problem was sorted a few hours later and it appeared that the booking came through another agent. The first room we had was at the front and was noisy from the main street outside plus the window did not close properly. Wife has back problems and the bed was "lumpy".Next morning I complained(in a nice way!) and we were moved to a room at the back,a twin, which was bigger,quieter and the beds were more comfortable.All the reception staff were pleasant,competent and ready to answer any questions we had. Breakfast is 11 Euros each(expensive and we never had it) so we walked round the corner where there are plenty of bars offering good deals for breakfast..we never paid more than 7 Euros for both of us. Hotel is handy for Metro stop "Hospital/Clinic" where you only have 3 further stops to Sagrada Familla.Also,just 10 metres away is a restaurant/pizzeria called Mario which does takeaways and the hotel had no objections to us bringing in a pizza and drinking a bottle of wine in the room..they even opened the bottle for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: craghopper_clj
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here in August 2010. Room was small and the bed a little hard but otherwise comfortable, although the street outside was quite noisy. Hotel claims to have a pool but we never found it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent breakfast, very clean & served it's purpose! :)”
Reviews.Author: scital
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 2 nights here and found it to be a pleasant stay. As we were out most of the time we wasnt too bothered where we stayed but we were more than happy. All staff we came into contact with were helpful and they looked happy to work there which is a unique these days! Close to the metro, which I have to say is amazing, didn't wait more than 2 mins for a train and 16€ for 3 days travel is value for money. Would definitely stay again, in fact I am thinking of rebooking here for when I go to see a Barca game next month.

Reviews.Title: “nice but...”
Reviews.Author: blerda
Reviews.Content: Rooms very noisy especially with the windows from the street. Hard bed. Heating unstable. Leaky windows. But.... good price, good location - 30 minutes walk to the center, or stadium, very nice service, cleaned daily, delicious breakfast with elements of Spanish cuisine!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but clean”
Reviews.Author: Trips1211
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but clean. The towels were changed daily but for the 3 days we stayed in, they did not put in new toiletries. The hotel is located in a busy street so it is very noisy with the traffic, so if you have a light sleep, I do not recommend this. Around there some places to eat but not very nice dishes. As to location we used the metro and its about 3 stops to city center, but you need to change metro line. The journey is quick, about 10 to 15 min in total as the underground is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BraveheartA
Reviews.Content: Just spent a very pleasant 4 days in this hotel just out of the city hustle and bustle. Breakfast buffet selection was first class as was the total ambiance of the place. Very easy access to Girona airport as no 54 bus leaves round the corner and terminates at the Estacio Nord where airport bus leaves from. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a basic, CLEAN, cheap place to stay near subway...this is it.”
Reviews.Author: kimmyny21
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and staff friendly. My friend came back late one night and the door was locked, BUT the desk guy was just running to the bathroom and I think this is a safety thing, which made us feel ok. Water is always hot and beds were comfortable. The room is small, but when travelling, you dont spend much time in the room. I thought it was perfect for what I needed. A little off the beaten path, but just steps away from subway which was perfect. A little noisy, but I can sleep through anything. If you are looking for clean and affordable, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ar0unddworld
Reviews.Content: Sunotel's rooms are quite spacious and we liked the hotel. Not a very modern hotel though. The rooms are clean .. but there are some issues with the air-con which are not working at night.. not very quiet though coz it is by the main road.. but it is near to the metro which is about 10 minutes walk away .. and around the neighbourhood there are many shops available and restaurants.. We didn't manage to see the swimming pool as we were at barcelonetta most of the time.. and touring around .. but for a 3 nights stay.. Oh.. and the receptionist was really friendly too.. and he did explain to me how to get to certain places in Barcelona.. and there are also friendly people who lingers around the lobby which you can get to know them and exchange travel experiences.. And the wifi is a great addition to the hotel.. it really helps us to get in touch with friends and family on the move.. i really can't think to stay in a room with-out wifi.. Other than the air-con issues .. we enjoyed our stay here..

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting the city (however, see note about A/C!)!!”
Reviews.Author: BCZip
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a location close to my friend's home, yet not too far away for sightseeing and typical "tourist" things. This location was perfect for all of this. The nightlife is great, safe and the people are so friendly. SAFE location. I was out late with (local) friends most nights, and never felt unsafe returning to the hotel at any hour. I was also able to shop at local grocery stores - very convenient. Pros: 1) The location of this hotel is perfect! It is 2 blocks from the Hospital Clinic metro station (south of the hotel), which connects you to most anywhere you want to go. This is a mostly residential area, with a few schools nearby. (I chose this location because it was close to my friends' homes.) 2) There are many restaurants/cafes, grocery stores, and bars/clubs very close to the hotel. 3) Room and bathroom were clean. 4) Staff was friendly, accomodating, and helped me with my Catalan/Spanish. Cons: *) Room (#41) was a decent size, for being in the city. However, this room was next to the elevator, which is very noisy when doors open/close or when the elevator stops/starts. The room was also facing the street, which can be noisy at times, but no more than you would expect in a busy city. 1) A/C - Air works fine. However, after 4 days my air conditioning was turned off by the hotel - literally, the vent was blocked, preventing air from getting into the room. This caused me to not be able to sleep 1 night, as I had to wait until the morning (I thought) to have the maintenance team work on it. In the morning, I told the front desk, and they turned it back on immediately. This happened again 2 days later, and yet again 2 days after that (total of 3 times); each time, I told the front desk and they turned it back on immediately. This would not be an issue, if there was a fan to circulate air within the room. The window only opens slightly, so unless there is a southern breeze, it is useless. The room becomes stuffy and hot without the A/C on. 2) Elevator noise - was very loud. 3) Phone Calls/Messages - I received several phone calls from friends here in Barcelona. The front desk tried to get to me, but I was not available in my room. My friends left messages, but the hotel does not notify you that you have any messages. 4) TV/Cable: - Small (approx. 13") TV. Since I was out most each day, this really did not bother me; however, if you want to spend a day watching the games, it's not the best TV. - Limited channels (about 14); most are News - late at night, several become "contest" (phone-in) shows. Overall, this is a great little hotel in a non-tourist part of town. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Good 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: fused27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Hospital Clinic metro. Although there is a garage opposite, there are two more shops i.e. Cabpro and Discor nearby. Use bus 59 (very frequent) as the stops is a 3 minute walk away and gets you down to Plaza Catalunya in 10 mins. Ask for a room that does not face the road and you would be fine. I know a lot of others complain about this and that about the hotel, (room size, noise, blah..blah..) but in reality, the rooms are very acceptable and comfortable. Hairdrier, toileteries and good shower (some expect things to be the same as the US would complain about the shower) for the price paid. Another tip, Maitea, a famous Basque rest ,nearby the hotel, is great for tapas and reasonably priced compared to Las Ramblas area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Espana23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were pretty disappointed with this hotel. First of all, they are very misleading with where they are located (advertised/online on travelvelocity). They claimed to be located on Las Ramblas/Barri Gottic when in reality they are two train rides (about 15 to 20 minutes) away. The room was extremely small for two people and the bathroom was incredibly small, the t.v. was extremely small, their was constantly noise that could be heard throughout the night and no air conditioning. The crazy thing is that your room key has to go into a slot on the wall in order for the electricity to work in the rooms. It is there way of saving energy but then the fridge is off throughout the day and your drinks are warm. However, the hotel was clean and the staff was pleasant. The cleanliness of the hotel was the best part of our stay there. I do not plan on going back nor recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a noisy aircondition”
Reviews.Author: mzzille
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Junior Hotel in December. Although the room was quite small, it was O.K. so far. Not much to complain. In the night, they have turned on the air condition every now and again to heat the hotel. It was terrible. It was so loud, I hardly slept. After the second night I moved to another hotel. Maybe it is better during summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: xheatherxrfcx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for the Rangers champions league game. Check in was fine and the guy on reception was pleasant. Rooms were excellent more than I would expect from 2 star. Only problem I had here was the room was freezing at nightime. No heating and the cover was a bit flimsy apart from that the stay was fine. Contary to other reports I found the night man most helpful especially when me and my boyfriend were being a bit daft and had a problem with the room key.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster, incompetence!”
Reviews.Author: JuliainToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at thishotel from August 28 to September 3, 2007 and during our 6 night stay, we had to change our room a total of 3 times! When we arrived on the first day, there was a mini fridge in our room that was operating but the a/c in our room was not working. It was about 33 degrees at the time. We went to reception to inform them that there was no a/c in our room and it seemed that they were well aware there was no a/c and offered us the use of a small table fan "for now" as there were no other rooms available at the moment. As we had no other alternative, we accepted the use of the small fan and opened our window and suffered through the heat and noise of the street for that night. The next day, we were moved to another room - with operational a/c and a mini fridge. When we arrived at this room, the a/c was working - but the mini fridge was not so we could not keep any water or anything cold - and boy was it warm. Again, we went back to the reception to report the fridge not working and a male receptionist told us very firmly that we were "expecting too much from a hotel which is only rated as a 2-star hotel". Now we were really ticked off and I demanded to speak to the hotel manager once again. Upon speaking to the hotel manager, I told him that if he could not provide us with the service that we have paid for, then please send us to an alternate hotel - where we will receive the services that we have paid for and we are expecting. He said he would "see what he could do by tomorrow morning". The next day, yet again we were given our third room - on the top floor of the hotel, the 5th floor - where everything was working o.k. until our last night's stay. When we arrived back at the hotel in the evening from sightseeing during the day, we were told by a female receptionist that "we have had some problems with the elevator today and I am sorry but you will have to walk upstairs to your room and I am not sure if the elevator will even be working by tomorrow". She continued on by saying that "we even had to call the fire department". Now we were wondering what really took place here while we were away from the hotel all day and walking up a total of approximately 102 steps was not our idea of fun after walking for many hours already. Once we went up to our room and turned on the faucet in the bathroom, we noticed that the water must have been shut off for a time as the water coming out of the faucet was flowing irregularly as if it had been shut off for a time. We went for dinner and came back to our room and now noticed that the mini fridge in our room was no longer working and through the night, the a/c also stopped working as well. The next morning, we walked down the several flights of stairs to the basement to have breakfast and we noticed that there were only a few people in the breakfast room. Of course, not many people would enjoy walking up and down over 100 steps. However, as it was our last day, we thought we would have breakfast and get our things ready and check out. There was now an OUT OF ORDER sign on the elevators and we asked the receptionist if there was someone that could help us with our luggage from the 5th floor. We were told that there was only 1 guy available "as everyone else is in the basement cleaning up the mess as a water pipe had burst". Now we knew why our water was running intermittent the previous day. The photos on the internet do not do this hotel justice and I would not recommend staying at this hotel for anymore that a day. You just never know what will happen next and living like this - on your vacation - is extremely unpleasant. It was no use taking your things out of the suitcase as every other day we changed rooms. Choose another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away from tourist area, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: McMeakin
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, modern clean hotel. Air conditioned rooms with complementary bathroom products. The night receptionist was especially helpful. The hotel is easily reached by metro (Hospital Clinic station). We asked for room away from the road as other reviewers had mentioned the road noise, this request was granted. The room was an odd shape but perfectly adequate. We had not booked the hotel breakfast (€10pp) and had planned to use the Pans & Co across the road, instead we had an excellent breakfast in La Fornet (less than €5pp) only two doors down from the hotel. Across the road is a garage for snacks and water supplies and an excellent pizza restaurant (similar to Pizza Express), very handy as we arrived on a late-ish flight. We bought a 3 day transport pass, available at all metro stations, that gave us unlimited use of the metro, buses and also the train back to the airport. We found this was easier than a T-10 as we did not have to worry about when the ticket would run out. I would recommend this hotel to COUPLES who want to be able to get out of the tourist centre yet still be central to reach all the sights. EXCELLENT VALUE.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: cbc27
Reviews.Content: The hotel Junior was a good hotel. Positives include: good location (just outside of the tourist areas), great breakfast, and accomodating staff. Negatives include: small room and street noise. Overall though, good hotel for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RolandDSilva
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights in Mar 2007, and very pleased with the experience. Conveniently located - 5 mins from a metro station, and slightly away from the most touristy part of town (Barri Gotic and Ramblas) where I think the rooms would be more cramped. The room was small, but adequate. Bathroom was nice and well appointed. Walls are thin, like all hotels of this nature. Staff were friendly. Would definitely stay there again and highly recommend this as a good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lork
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel by taxi from the airport, which cost approx €25. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, and speak good English. Our room, number 46, was fairly small and an odd shape but perfectly adequate for the amount of time we spent there. The room was spotlessly clean and overlooked a small courtyard so we weren't disturbed by traffic noise from the main road. The rooms have a TV and mini bar but the prices were obviously quite inflated. The petrol station / garage across the road sells drinks and snacks a lot cheaper. Breakfast is in the Aston Hotel round the corner and there was a good selection of fruit, pastries, cereal, etc which is replenished regularly. The only downside is that the rooms have hard floors, rather than carpets, and we were woken up a few times by inconsiderate guests next door and above us stomping about with high heeled shoes on. The hotel itself is approx a 5 minute walk from the Hospital Clinic metro station. We bought a T-10 ticket which gives you 10 journeys for €6.90 and shared the ticket between the two of us. There are plenty of cafes and bars in the area and a few restaurants. We had a lovely meal at the Restaurante Peppo a few doors down from the hotel, towards Carrer de Londres. We had two courses with drinks and coffee for €37, which was great value for money. I'd stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “outrageous”
Reviews.Author: littlemiss56
Reviews.Content: upon arriving at the hotel at just before midnight on the 8th dec 06 there was a party of twelve colleagues from work. we had booked 6 twin rooms weeks in advance as there was only two couples in the party. i was hoping to just crawl into bed and sleep, however when my partner and i got to the room it was filthy, the bed sheets had not been changed the dirty towels lay on the floor, there was cigratte ash everywhere and the toilet hadn't even been flushed. not only that they had given us six double rooms and though this was fine for the couples it was not fine for everybody else. a mother and daughter in the party had to share a single bed!! as for the rest of the party after nearly an hour complaining to the staff, matresses were put on the floor in the double rooms. we were told we woyuld recieve a discount the next day, which we never recieved. to add to this that the restaurant and the bar we were told were in our hotell were actually in a different hotel and were closed. andthe hotel was not as close to the tourist atrractions as the website states. to be quite honest the service we recieved was appaling and i would nver go back to this hotel. the staff even threatened to call the police when we complained my advice is choose a different hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: DannyKetteringUK
Reviews.Content: Having just returned (June 06)after spending 5 nights at the Hotel Junior I just had to write and commend this Hotel ,found it to be spotlessly clean , staff very friendly and helpfull, this hotel certainly deserves more than 2 stars, oh! and I nearly forgot to mention the excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hard to believe this is a two star hotel. staff extremely helpful,special mention to marco, rooms lovely, swiming pool a real bonus. would have liked bar to stay open a little later.would recomend to family and friends. signed paddy and sandra kinsella.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful staff in clean, welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Capricorn55
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in early December 2005. The hotel was very clean with extremely welcoming, helpful staff, checking addresses on the internet, showing places of interest on maps etc. All spoke English. Room was big with smart bathroom and, as I requested, I had a bathroom with a tub rather than just a shower. I travelled to the hotel from the airport via train and metro which took over two hours but returned via the airport bus (from Placa d'Espagna) and taxi which was only 25 minutes in all and a few Euros more expensive (lots of stairs and few escalators in metro, so the bus is easier if you have lots of luggage and/or mobility problems). As a woman travelling alone, I felt the area where the hotel is situated was very safe and only about 20 minutes door to door to La Rambla area via metro. The Barcelona Card is a great way to get around the city and have discounts/free entry/travel to various attractions (check out the municipal swimming baths/leisure centre, Passeig Maritime, near the Olympic towers, 8 pools, sauna etc, entry was only 6 Euros open until midnight in the week). I bought my Barcelona Card at the airport but they are on sale at tourist offices etc. The only problem that I had with the hotel was the traffic noise but I invested £1 in some earplugs which cut all sound. Hot and cold buffet breakfast was fine, there is a bakery on the corner plus all night garage nearby which sells groceries and alcohol. PLEASE be careful about pickpockets in Barcelona. I met many people who had been stung, one by a very slick gang who pretended a bird had made a mess on a womans head, they came to her rescue with bottled water and tissues whilst stealing her husbands wallet. Also whilst on a tour of the cathedral, a member of my tour had her purse stolen. Just be very careful as you would in any big city and do not let the pickpockets put you off visiting this amazing, beautiful place. I would really recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again either travelling alone or with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent allround except for traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: hobnobs2
Reviews.Content: The Junior Hotel is situated in Avinguda de Sarria 5 minutes walk from Hospital Clinic metro station. The bus stop for both the red and blur routes on the Bus Turistic is 7 minutes walk away. The centre can be reach by public transport within 15 minutes. The accommodation itself is a high standard in our opinion above its 2* classification. The rooms are clean, simply but tastefully furnished with air conditioning. The bathrooms are excellent and the buffet breakfast we can recommend. The staff go out of their way to be helpful and reception is manned 24 hours a day. The main drawback is the hotel is situated on a main road and most rooms suffer from some traffic noise during the night which is disturbing when you want a good night sleep so you can sight see the next day. Apart from this aspect we cannot fault this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Sunotel Junior
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Sarria 9, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
